intro: Randia claesii, commonly known as the red spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling small spiders, hence its common name. Randia claesii typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
